channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Must Share Search Data With Rivals, Judge Rules in Antitrust Case
item.description: In a landmark antitrust case, Judge Amit P. Mehta ruled on Tuesday that Google must hand over some of its search data to rivals but did not grant the ...

item.title: Stocks are falling towards their worst day in a month amid tech sector declines and tariff concerns
item.description: Wall Street is sinking on Tuesday as rising pressure from the bond market pulls U.S. stocks further from their records.

item.title: Federal judge orders Google to end exclusive search distribution deals, but won’t force Google to sell Chrome
item.description: The ruling is part of the government’s landmark antitrust case against Google-parent Alphabet

item.title: 3 reasons why Klarna’s valuation has fallen by nearly 70% from its peak just a few years ago
item.description: Once Europe's most valuable startup and the second-highest fintech at $45.6 billion, it's going public at a $14 billion valuation.

item.title: Paris Hilton took out a mortgage on the $63 million mansion she bought from Mark Wahlberg. Here’s why that’s actually a smart financial decision
item.description: The reality star made a savvy move in financing her megamansion.

item.title: Walmart and Target are allegedly forcing employees to remove tags on apparel to make it easier to jack up prices based on tariffs
item.description: Social media posts claim that removing price tags can allow the retailers to raise prices more easily, possibly in response to tariffs.

item.title: Judge Apologizes to Conservative Justices in Case Over N.I.H. Cuts
item.description: The display of contrition came after Justices Gorsuch and Kavanaugh issued a stern warning directing judges to heed their orders in August.

item.title: L.A. Ruling Complicates Trump’s Threats to Send Troops to More Cities
item.description: As Democratic cities brace for possible military deployments, Democratic governors see in a lower-court ruling the potential for legal protections.

item.title: Maduro Says War With Venezuela Would Stain Trump’s Hands with Blood
item.description: As U.S. warships and troops gather in the Caribbean, Mr. Maduro threatened an “armed fight” in response to any military action. He also appealed for p...

item.title: Mass Migration and Liberalism’s Fall
item.description: A decade on, Angela Merkel’s immigration disaster has created a right-wing surge.

item.title: Assad and Aides Are Wanted in France for Deadly Strike on Journalists
item.description: Judges issued arrest warrants for Bashar al-Assad and six officials of his regime in Syria for an attack that killed two journalists, including Marie ...

item.title: Similar Names Lead to Misdirected Anger in U.S. Open Hat-Snatching Scandal
item.description: The chief executive of the Polish company Drogbruk was captured on video snatching a hat in front of a child. The head of Drog-Bruk, a different firm,...

item.title: Netanyahu Faces High-Level Opposition to His Stance on Gaza Truce
item.description: High-level political and security figures are said to be resisting the prime minister’s demand for a comprehensive deal to end the war in Gaza.
